trick.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: something you do in order to deceive someone
trick.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
He didn’t really lose his wallet – that’s just a trick.
trick.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: something you do to surprise someone and to make other people laugh
trick.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’m getting tired of your silly tricks.
The girls were playing tricks on their teacher.
trick.translation[0].definitions[2].sign: something that makes things appear different
trick.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: something that makes things appear to be different from the way they really are
trick.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: After walking for hours in the hot sun, his mind began playing tricks on him.
At first he thought someone was coming towards him, but it was just a trick of the light.
trick.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a skilful set of actions that seem like magic, done to entertain people
trick.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: My uncle was always showing me card tricks when I was a kid.
trick.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a way of doing something that works very well but may not be easy to notice
trick.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
a salesman who knew all the tricks of the trade  (=clever methods used in a particular job)
trick.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: the cards played or won in one part of a game of cards
trick.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: He won the first three tricks easily.
trick.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: someone who pays a prostitute to have sex
trick.translation[0].definitions[6].note: turn a trick (=to have sex with someone for money)
trick.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something
trick.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
He claimed he was tricked into carrying drugs.
The corporation was tricked out of $20 million.
He tricked his way into her home by pretending to be a policeman.
trick your way into/past/onto etc something
